definition: disciple/apprentice/believer/on foot/bare or empty/to no avail/only/prison sentence

sentences.english: We are products of our past, but we don't have to be prisoners of it.
sentences.chinese: 我們都是過往的產物，卻不一定要成爲過往的囚徒。

sentences.english: I rap for listeners, blunt heads, fly ladies and prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 我爲聆聽者，大麻葉而說唱，也能讓女士，囚徒。

sentences.english: Not squares for boys like prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 對男孩子們不要方方正正的像囚徒。

sentences.english: They walk by an older man holding a cat. Michael inquires about him.
sentences.chinese: 他們走過一個老囚徒身邊，那人手裏抱着一隻貓。

sentences.english: Prisoner, tell me, who was it that bound you?
sentences.chinese: 囚徒，告訴我，是誰將你捆縛？

sentences.english: Saddam to set an army of ex-prisoners against Washington's saboteurs.
sentences.chinese: 薩達姆大羣的獲釋囚徒對抗華盛頓派遣的蓄意破壞者。

sentences.english: Never in your life will you have such a captive audience.
sentences.chinese: 你一生中再也不會有這樣的囚徒般的觀衆。

sentences.english: Naturally, the prisoners think that the shadows are real things.
sentences.chinese: 自然地，囚徒把那些影子當作真實的東西。

sentences.english: Levchenko was a veritable prisoner, which was not healthy.
sentences.chinese: 列夫欽科真的成了名符其實的囚徒了，這太不象樣子。

sentences.english: It is a conundrum in game theory known as a prisoner's dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 這在搏弈理論中被稱做囚徒的困境。

sentences.english: Family members and friends of the imprisoned can send messages through this system.
sentences.chinese: 囚徒的家屬和朋友能夠通過這個系統傳遞信息。

sentences.english: Men are not prisoners of fate, but prisoners of their own minds-orson welles.
sentences.chinese: 人並非命運的困獸，卻只會成爲自己思想的囚徒。

sentences.english: I am the farmer, bondsman to the soil.

sentences.chinese: 或者是它們不能饒恕的囚徒？

sentences.english: Once I met with a dozen enemy soldiers and took them prisoners singlehanded .
sentences.chinese: 一次我遇到一打敵兵，單獨把他們捉拿爲囚徒。

sentences.english: Not squares for children are rough like prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 對男孩子們不要方方正正的像囚徒。

definition: prisoner that awaits execution/convict sentenced to death/someone on death row
cage used to hold or transport prisoners
cage/trap (e.g. basket, pit or snare for catching animals)/fig. bonds (of wrong ideas)/shackles (of past misconceptions)/to trap/to shackle
